events.title: Decades Dance Party
events.desc:
Whether you operate on the academic calendar or not, come celebrate the dance party to end all dance parties! üçéüçèüçé School = Apple = Charli üíö

Never been to Decades? Here‚Äôs how it works:

üçè Every hour is a new decade of music from the 70s until the 2020s.

üçé Every hour is a new DJ.

üçè The top of every hour is a confetti-fuelled countdown into the next decade.

It‚Äôs kinda like six new years‚Äô parties in one. Except it‚Äôs not new years. And we‚Äôre dancing for six hours long. Don‚Äôt forget to bring comfy dancing shoes.

Music starts at 8PM. No cover.

events.title: TEMOM (Toronto Electronic Music Open Mic)
events.desc:
Electronic Music Open Mic or EMOM for short is an open stage night for local electronic musicians.

This night is aimed at giving local electronic music artists a supportive space to play live and experiment. Seeking all forms of electronic music including: ambient, soundtrack, dance, techno, noise, electropop, experimental, drone, glitch, hip-hop, field recordings, electrojazz, vocal, chiptune, looping, synth-wave, trance, live coding, sound design, etc.

Get out of your home studio or bedroom, and come out to a fun, supportive night with other enthusiastic gear heads, dabblers and live electronic music fans alike. You don‚Äôt have to be a songwriter or established artist with a full repertoire. This is for anyone who wants to try their hand at playing live in a safe, motivating environment. Phone apps, tiny gizmos, drum machines, loop stations, groove boxes, DJ controllers, sequencers, samplers, loose change and a contact mic, modular synths, computers, digital boxes and everything in between‚Ä¶All welcome!

Come out and meet other music makers, producers and creative types of all kinds. There should be plenty of time to talk gear, production techniques and exchange a whole range of inspiring ideas.

Sign up the night on-site or contact Carl Armstrong directly on the TEMOM Facebook page to get on the sign-up sheet beforehand.

Slots are up to 15 minutes (with additional set-up, play and pack down times). Get there early to avoid disappointment. There is a small main stage with lighting, full live-music speaker system/monitors, and an audio tech that will handle mixing to the main PA. We will have a table for you to setup on, and another one to the side, off the stage, for the next performer to prep/wrap their gear. Please be self-contained either with a direct connection to the in-house DI box (1/4 inch left and right(ts), 1/8 stereo, stereo RCA connectors) or with your own sub-mixer that we can run a stereo line from.

Sorry - no acoustic guitars ‚Äì unless they are being used to generate soundscapes or some other style of music in keeping with the night (through pedals, FX units etc.)

events.title: Book Doof #1
events.desc:
Stereo Ferment presents BOOK DOOF

Thirsday September 12th we're kicking off a night that celebrates the union of underground music and zine culture @handlebar_to in Kensington Market.

For the debut event, we'll be launching season 2 of @doomlands , a cartoon series by Josh O'Keefe.

Featuring zines and art by

Brandon Celi @brandonceli

Sam Reilly @bipolarsexdisorder

Xiaoxiao Li @xiao_xli

2 x secret bands

DJ set by @orekusound

Hosted by Roger Bainbridge (voice of Jep)

Doors at 7pm

Doomlands screening 7:30PM

All dance freaks, zine geeks and everyone inbetween are welcome!

Tickets are PWYC!
